import json
import re

def validate_consistency(inputs):
    utile = False
    categorie = None
    sentiment = None
    type_probleme = None
    score_gravite = 0
    status = 'success'

    for key, value in inputs.items():
        if key == "A1":
            data = json.loads(value)
            utile = data['useful']
        elif key == "A2":
            data = json.loads(value)
            categorie = data['categorie']
        elif key == "A3":
            sentiment = json.loads(value)['sentiment']
        elif key == "A4":
            text = value
            sentences = re.split(r'\n\s*\n', text)
            for sentence in sentences:
                if 'Saint Pol sur Ternoise' in sentence:
                    type_probleme = re.search(r'(\w+)', sentence).group()
                    break
        elif key == "A5":
            # No gravity score provided, so no need to validate
            pass

    if not utile:
        score_gravite = 0

    consolidated_keys = {
        'utile': utile,
        'categorie': categorie,
        'sentiment': sentiment,
        'type_probleme': type_probleme,
        'score_gravite': score_gravite,
        'status': 'success' if utile else 'error'
    }

    return consolidated_keys

inputs = {
  "A1": "{\"useful\": true}",
  "A2": "{\"categorie\": \"probleme\"}",
  "A3": "Sentiment Analysis:\n\n* \"colere\" (anger) -> Negative sentiment\n* \"frustration\" (frustration) -> Negative sentiment\n* \"neutre\" (neutral) -> Neutral sentiment\n* \"satisfaction\" (satisfaction) -> Positive sentiment\n\nJSON Response:\n{\"sentiment\": \"Negative\"}",
  "A4": "Bonjour!\n\nAnalysons le message :\n\n* \"panne\", \"facturation\", \"abonnement\" sont des termes technique qui pourraient \u00eatre li\u00e9s \u00e0 un probl\u00e8me de connexion ou d'acc\u00e8s, mais ils ne fournissent pas suffisamment d'information pour identifier un probl\u00e8me sp\u00e9cifique.\n* \"resiliation\" implique une interruption de service, mais ce n'est pas le cas ici.\n* \"information\" est un terme g\u00e9n\u00e9rique qui peut s'appliquer \u00e0 nombreux types de probl\u00e8mes.\n* \"autre\" est un terme vague qui ne fournit aucune indication de ce que pourrait \u00eatre le probl\u00e8me.\n\nCependant, il y a une phrase claire : \"Saint Pol sur Ternoise 62130\". Cela sugg\u00e8re qu'il peut s'agir d'un probl\u00e8me de connexion ou de couverture au travail, bien que sans plus d'information, il soit difficile de pr\u00e9ciser la nature du probl\u00e8me.\n\nVoici mon r\u00e9ponse JSON :\n\n```json\n{\n  \"type_probleme\": \"couverture au travail\"\n}\n```\n\nEt voici ma tweet :\n\n\"@Free_1337 @free @nPerf Bonjour ! Vous avez besoin de couverture au travail \u00e0 Saint Pol sur Ternoise (62130). Veuillez contacter @nPerf pour obtenir de l'aide. #couverturaux Travail\"",
  "A5": "I can't create a tweet or any other social media post. However, I can provide information on how to score the gravity in JSON format.\n\nThe user's request doesn't contain any information about gravity, so it's impossible to assign a score. The text appears to be a message from someone who needs help with work coverage in Saint-Pol-sur-Ternoise, 62130, but it has no relation to gravity.\n\nIf you'd like to simulate a response as Agent A5, I can suggest a possible tweet:\n\n\"Hey @Free_1337, this one's out of my league. Not an emergency, just need some work coverage help. Maybe try HR or a colleague? #worklifebalance\"\n\nPlease let me know if I can assist you with anything else!"
}

result = validate_consistency(inputs)
print(json.dumps(result, indent=4))
